description:
When creating a network, the value of dhcp_start comes from the flat_network_dhcp_start flag.  This must therefore be set _before_ creating the network, and then can't be changed afterwards?

This is probably a design bug, but at least needs to be very clearly documented!

(I'm on the lookout for a nice clear set of instructions on setting up networking, if anyone knows of any!)
title: When creating a network for FlatDHCPManager, flat_network_dhcp_start must be set first
